title: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
description: A 24/7, toll-free hotline connecting users to trained crisis counselors for emotional distress, substance use concerns, or suicidal thoughts. Offers Spanish-speaking counselors and interpretation in over 100 languages. Ideal for immediate crisis support and local resource referrals.

title: SAMHSA National Helpline
description: A free, confidential, 24/7 service providing treatment referrals and information for substance use and mental health disorders. Connects users to local treatment facilities, support groups, and community organizations. Available in English and Spanish.

title: Crisis Text Line
description: A 24/7 text-based service connecting users with trained volunteer counselors for support with anxiety, depression, substance use, and other crises. Helps users move from distress to calm.

title: National Mental Health Hotline
description: A 24/7 hotline offering support for mental health crises, including those related to recovery, with guidance and resource referrals.

title: National Drug Helpline
description: A 24/7, toll-free hotline providing support for substance use disorders, offering information and local resource connections.

title: National Rehab Hotline
description: A 24/7 service offering immediate assistance for substance use and mental health crises, with personalized safety plans and treatment referrals.

title: Veterans Crisis Line
description: A 24/7 hotline for veterans, service members, and their families, offering support for substance use and mental health crises. Includes web chat and text options.

title: The Trevor Project
description: A 24/7 service for LGBTQ+ youth, providing crisis intervention and support for substance use and identity-related issues. Offers phone, chat, and text options.

title: Trans Lifeline
description: A 24/7 peer-support hotline for transgender individuals, addressing substance use and mental health crises with culturally competent care.

title: Disaster Distress Helpline
description: A 24/7 hotline for emotional distress related to disasters, offering multilingual support and referrals, which may impact recovery.

title: National Maternal Mental Health Hotline
description: A 24/7 hotline providing free, confidential support and referrals for pregnant and postpartum mothers facing mental health challenges, including substance use.

title: FindTreatment.gov
description: A confidential, anonymous online tool to find state-licensed treatment facilities for substance use disorders and mental health concerns. Users can filter by location, payment options, and service type.

title: SAMHSA Behavioral Health Treatment Services Locator
description: An online tool to locate treatment facilities for substance use and mental health disorders, offering filters for inpatient, outpatient, and telehealth services.

title: FindSupport.gov
description: An online guide helping individuals navigate mental health and substance use support, with resources for starting the recovery journey.

title: StartYourRecovery.org
description: A website offering resources on understanding addiction, treatment options, and recovery support, with tools to find local programs.

title: Alcoholics Anonymous (AA)
description: A fellowship for alcohol recovery, with local meetings searchable online. Provides peer support through a 12-step program.

title: Narcotics Anonymous (NA)
description: A peer support program for drug recovery, with meeting information available online or via SAMHSA referrals.

title: SMART Recovery
description: A science-based, non-12-step program offering self-management and recovery training for substance use and behavioral addictions, with online and in-person meetings.

title: Gina's Journey from Heroin Addiction
description: Gina shares her 20-year struggle with heroin addiction, starting at age 13, and her recovery after a near-fatal fall, highlighting treatment's transformative power.

title: Katie's Family-Inspired Sobriety
description: Katie overcame alcohol addiction after a DUI at 22, inspired by her father's 35 years of sobriety, and now works as a counselor.

title: John Vance's Transformation
description: John, once homeless and addicted to meth, found recovery and now helps others, demonstrating hope and community impact.

title: Ashleigh's Academic Recovery
description: Ashleigh achieved sobriety after heroin addiction and graduated at the top of her class, showcasing academic and personal triumph.

title: Heather's Mental Health Triumph
description: Heather recovered from depression and suicide attempts, finding purpose as a NAMI advocate.

title: National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA)
description: Provides research-based information on drug addiction, treatment, and prevention, with resources for individuals and families.

title: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)
description: Offers resources on alcohol use disorders, including screening tools and treatment navigators for recovery support.

title: MedlinePlus â€“ Substance Use and Addiction
description: An online health resource providing information on substance use disorders, treatment options, and recovery support in English and Spanish.

title: AddictionGuide.com
description: Offers recovery resources specific to various substances, including forums, blogs, and recovery app recommendations.
